author: Special Correspondent
text:
Director of Municipal Administration G. Prakash said that 400 LED lights have been installed on the bunds of the Mahamaham tank and they would turn the night into day flooding the entire zone with lighting.

More than 100 street lights have been installed in the other parts of the town, he said.

On the cleanliness aspect at the Mahamaham tank, he said the tank was being replenished with 60 lakh litres of fresh, treated water daily and special medical teams have been posted to monitor the purity of the water every 15 minutes.

Free temporary toilets have been established at 147 spots and they were being maintained round the clock while special flying squads monitor their cleanliness.

A total of 168 drinking water tanks have been put up around the town and 19 tankers would feed them throughout the day and night.

The town has been divided into six zones headed by as many municipal commissioners who were directing 202 officials and 700 conservancy staff drawn from all over the State, he said.

The municipality has spent more than Rs. 50 crore for the Mahamaham work for various civic requirements, Municipal Chairperson Rathna Sekar, who was also there, said.

Regional Director of Municipal Administration R. Kalimuthu, and Commissioner Umamaheswari accompanied Mr. Prakash during the inspection.
title: 400 LED lights installed on bunds of tank
